column6: "Minas Tirith (chapter)" was a hereditary title conferred by the kings of Gondor.

column1: The title was first given by Elendil to a house of Númenóreans nobles
column3: that had settled in Belfalas in or near to Edhellond.J.R.R. Tolkien
column7: note 39 Some two thousand years later
column9: Galador was the first of this line to use the title Prince of Dol Amroth.J.R.R. Tolkien

column1: In  King Aragorn of Gondor created the title Prince of Ithilien and gave it to Faramir
Peregrin Took was also informally known as the Prince of the Halflings by the people of Minas Tirith during his time there.
